Docs.summary: A collection of the BLOBs associated with a health record item.
Docs.remarks: The is a dictionary that is read-only but allows removal of instances. To add instances to the dictionary use the method.

.method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class Microsoft.Health.Blob blob) cil managed

Docs.param: The Blob instance to locate in the BlobStore.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the BlobStore contains the specified Blob instance.
Docs.returns: True if the Blob instance is in the store or false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: This implementation is a reference comparison and does not equate Blob instances with the same name.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Health.Blob NewBlob (string blobName, string contentType);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.Blob NewBlob(string blobName, string contentType) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the BLOB. It can be but cannot be null.
The content type of the BLOB.
Docs.summary: Creates a BLOB in the store with the specified name, content type, and encoding.
Docs.returns: The instance that was created in the store.
Docs.exception: If a Blob with the same name already exists in the store. To update an existing Blob, remove the existing Blob and create a new one.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Health.Blob NewBlob (string blobName, string contentType, Microsoft.Health.BlobHashInfo hashInfo, Uri blobUrl);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.Blob NewBlob(string blobName, string contentType, class Microsoft.Health.BlobHashInfo hashInfo, class System.Uri blobUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the BLOB. It can be but cannot be null.
The content type of the BLOB.
The hash information for the BLOB.
The HealthVault URL of the BLOB.
Docs.summary: Recreates a BLOB in the store to allow for restarting multiple BLOB uploads on a .
Docs.returns: The instance that was recreated in the store.
Docs.remarks: This overload is intended to allow the caller to recover from issues that may arise while uploading large BLOBs or many BLOBs for a . If you have a large amount of data to upload, you can periodically save the state of the Blob instance (and BlobStream if necessary) and then use this method to recreate that same Blob instance in the store.
Docs.exception: If a Blob with the same name already exists in the store. To update an existing Blob, remove the existing Blob and create a new one.
